info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henderson County through 630 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southwest of Hendersonville, or 4 miles west of Flat Rock. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Etowah, Laurel Park, Saluda, Dupont State Forest, Valley Hill, Tuxedo, Crab Creek and East Flat Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
